Re: Integration of ExoSuites with Gatein?

Hi,

what is the recommended storage support for the JCR values ? Database or filesystem ?

Especially with a large number of contents.

 

Thomas

Hi,

what is the recommended storage support for the JCR values ? Database or filesystem ?

Especially with a large number of contents.

 

Thomas

Hi Thomas!
Value Storage concept was designed to allow You to store binary values away from database. And general recommendation is to use File System as a value storage back end. Usually it offers greater performance, especially when talking about rather big sizes. Look towards TreeFileValueStorage implementation. It is designed for cases, when you have huge number of files.

 

Best regards, Nikolay.
Re: Recommendation on JCR values storage

For pure performance point of view:

  • You can use both with Oracle since we got the same performances according to our benchmark results (http://tests.exoplatform.org/JCR/1.12.4-GA/rev.3041/japex-reports/index.html)
  • For any other supported Databases listed here https://jira.jboss.org/browse/EXOJCR-403, we recommend to use the file system since Blob type is not as well supported as Oracle does, especially for big files. You can also decide to store files bigger than a given size in the File System and the small files in the database as described here http://docs.jboss.org/exojcr/1.12.4-GA/developer/en-US/html_single/#d0e2369
Re: Recommendation on JCR values storage

Best regards

Discussions about eXo not specific to a single project.

Hello,

We discussed about this subject internally. I would like to know some if other have opinion about this.

We tested eXo on a multithread CPU and it does seem to be a lot faster that a single thread CPU.
 

What is better for eXo performance - Multimultithreading or fast CPUs?

What is your experience?

cu

Soren

Hi every body

I want to know what are the best manner and a recommanded tools to create new portlets and deploy them into exo.

I have foud Jboss Tools --> do you recomande me to use it??

is it a good idea to developpe a JSF portlet and deploy it into exo.

or it would be better to respect the technologies used under exo portal , portlets + groovy for UI.

so any help is welcome about the choice of the IDE + tools (Plugin) to use + language.

thank you in advance.

Hi every body

I want to know what are the best manner and a recommanded tools to create new portlets and deploy them into exo.

I have foud Jboss Tools --> do you recomande me to use it??

is it a good idea to developpe a JSF portlet and deploy it into exo.

or it would be better to respect the technologies used under exo portal , portlets + groovy for UI.

so any help is welcome about the choice of the IDE + tools (Plugin) to use + language.

thank you in advance.

Thank devoteam for the good question,

in fact for now we have no deeply technical usage gude like that for the community, however you can take the eXo training from here we have 3 levels for developer [url]http://exoplatform.com/company/public/website/services/production/production-training[/url]

I hope it can help

Hi,

 

As tuanpham said, there is no recommandations.

JBoss Tools is a good tool to develop portlets. It allows you to easily create and develop JSR 286 portlets or JSF portlets.

If you don't use Eclipse, I know that NetBeans provides a tool for portlets called Portal Pack (but I have never tried it).

About the language, once again I don't think there is one better solution over another. If you already develop your applications with JSF, it would be a good choice to use JSF portlets. JBoss Tools is good in this case, you can easily develop over JBoss Portlet Bridge.
how the web contents created or added to a previous version of eXo portal can be preserved to a newer eXo portal version? or is it possible at all to preserve the web contents?
how the web contents created or added to a previous version of eXo portal can be preserved to a newer eXo portal version? or is it possible at all to preserve the web contents?

[QUOTE=amirajababu]

how the web contents created or added to a previous version of eXo portal can be preserved to a newer eXo portal version? or is it possible at all to preserve the web contents?

[/QUOTE]

You preserve the underlaying database and change the eXo portal version. The new version has to point to the old database. (Attention if you use HSQLDB the database is stored in subfolders of your tomcat or jboss installation.)

From which version to which version?

Is it WCM?
thanks for your quick reply. yes I am working with eXo WCM in GateIn (3.0 to 3.1), and the database is Oracle. So, I just have to preserve the database and the web contents are preserved ?

I have an issue with the docbase for a new Groovy portlet.

I deployed the eXo portal under :

JBOSS/server/default/deploy/eXo.ear

I deployed my new portlet under

JBOSS/server/default/deploy/testRomain.war

 

Once I add the portlet to the portal I have the following error:

ERROR [portal:Lifecycle] Template: app:/groovy/testRomain/portlet/UITestRomainPortlet.gtmpl not found.

I can see my portlet but the groovy template is of course not visible.

The tutorial mentioned:

In src/main/resources/tomcat/, create a testRomain.xml file :

<Context path="/test" docBase="../../../eXoProjects/portal/trunk/portlet/testPortletRomain/src/main/webapp"
debug="0" reloadable="true" />
docBase must be set to webapp path of the portlet when you are in the tomcat bin directory.

How does that translate to a JBOSS installation?

Thanks in advance.

I have an issue with the docbase for a new Groovy portlet.

I deployed the eXo portal under :

JBOSS/server/default/deploy/eXo.ear

I deployed my new portlet under

JBOSS/server/default/deploy/testRomain.war

 

Once I add the portlet to the portal I have the following error:

ERROR [portal:Lifecycle] Template: app:/groovy/testRomain/portlet/UITestRomainPortlet.gtmpl not found.

I can see my portlet but the groovy template is of course not visible.

The tutorial mentioned:

In src/main/resources/tomcat/, create a testRomain.xml file :

<Context path="/test" docBase="../../../eXoProjects/portal/trunk/portlet/testPortletRomain/src/main/webapp"
debug="0" reloadable="true" />
docBase must be set to webapp path of the portlet when you are in the tomcat bin directory.

How does that translate to a JBOSS installation?

Thanks in advance.
Nevermind. The docbase is not required. I had a typo in the Groovy template name (.gtmp instead of .gtmpl), thus causing the lookup failure.

Helloo


I've got a few questions for which I hope you can answer:

- Do you offer PaaS?
- Is it possible to associate a domain name to a web app?
- Is it possible to develop applications compatible with iPhone/iPad?
- Is it possible to develop web applications with offline mode?

Can you details?

Thank you in advance for your support

Helloo


I've got a few questions for which I hope you can answer:

- Do you offer PaaS?
- Is it possible to associate a domain name to a web app?
- Is it possible to develop applications compatible with iPhone/iPad?
- Is it possible to develop web applications with offline mode?

Can you details?

Thank you in advance for your support

Hello Marwarn,

 

Your questions are a bit general, but I'll try to answer to my best.

 

[QUOTE=marwan]

- Do you offer PaaS?

[/QUOTE]

eXo itself does not have a PaaS offer. But we are working on bringing eXo Platform to the cloud.

Have a look at http://www.drawmeacloud.com where you'll see an experimental version of a eXo Social, with multi-tenancy enabled.

You can request the creation of a tenant and we'll automatically populate an instance of eXo Social just for it.

 

[QUOTE=marwan]
 - Is it possible to associate a domain name to a web app? [/QUOTE]

If the question is related to the previous : yes. Each tenant can have its own subdomain.

 

[QUOTE=marwan]
- Is it possible to develop applications compatible with iPhone/iPad? [/QUOTE]

iPhone and iPad are web-enabled devices. So the easy answer to this question is yes.

If you are talking of native applications, make a search in the app store and you'll find eXo Mobile.

 

[QUOTE=marwan]
- Is it possible to develop web applications with offline mode? [/QUOTE]

With the advant of html5, offline mode is a reality. As eXo hosts web applications, there are no reason why they cannot leverage html5. So the answer is yes.

Hi

Can you tell me please how to configure my portal to load automatically my custom workflow without the need to use workflow controller portlet ?

I wanted to use the same way as done for Payraise and Holiday workflows.

BR
How to add my custom workflow ?

Hi

Can you tell me please how to configure my portal to load automatically my custom workflow without the need to use workflow controller portlet ?

I wanted to use the same way as done for Payraise and Holiday workflows.

BR
How to add my custom workflow ?

Hi Sana,

First, I don't know on which version you are working.

So I will suppose that you are on WCM 2.0 (it is near the same for AIO 1.6.x)

In webapps/ecmworkflow-extension/WEB-INF/workflow-extension/workflow, you have all configuration files for WF, and in bonita-configuration, you set bonita WF to load at startup, and in jbpm-configuration, you set jbpm workflow. In theses files, you will see examples like payraise and holidays.
Re: How to add my custom workflow ?

Hello,

I've notices a bug in general in your technologies while opening simultaneously (ie, by ctrl/shift+clicking or middle-clicking quite fast) multiple pages in tabs.

Take for example the home screen of this forum and click on the different forums, like if you were doing the repetitive task of screening the last messages of all forums. You click fast and multiple tabs load at the same time.

You may then notice that the content of the tabs are a bit scrambled : you may have the exact same content, or the heading of one while having the list of a second and the page count of a third.
Clicking a a page count of one tab executes the associated action on one tab, so that I can end up in the "next page" of a different forum from another tab.

I've also tested on http://www.exoplatform.com/company/public/website/, clicking on the "Collaboration", "Social" and "Core Services" links just below the big fading banner. The result is random, but I have noticed among other that I had the same title while having different content (the urls were naturally different).

While typing this message I'm sure that if I click on a link to open it on a tab, it won't accept the submit of the form from the prior page.

The bug does not reproduce everywhere, for instance your xWiki seems to perform well (to be asserted).

 

By the way, I'm using Chromium 5.0.375.127 (55887) on Kubuntu 10.04.

Cheers and good luck for this/these bug(s) !
Olivier
Mark as resolved and change icon

Hi,

 

I would like to know what are eXo search capabilities:

what about  : 1)Solr , 2)Lucene, 3)Fast searching, 4)Layered searching ?

Hi,

 

I would like to know what are eXo search capabilities:

what about  : 1)Solr , 2)Lucene, 3)Fast searching, 4)Layered searching ?

Hello Marwan,

EXo Platform stores all the content in the eXo JavaContent Repository. This tool automatically inset the content using Apache Lucene. This is transparent and automatic.

All the applications in eXo will be using the lucene index when providing search capabilities.

I would like to understand what are the various use cases behind your question. I would like to see what we could take in the eXo roadmap.

You can also ask solution like solr, to crawl the site generated by eXo Content service, to provide new search capabilities.

Google Analytics requires that you place a piece of JavaScript code at the end of the <HEAD> section of a page. How do I go about adding this JavaScript code to eXo Platform 3.0?
Google Analytics requires that you place a piece of JavaScript code at the end of the <HEAD> section of a page. How do I go about adding this JavaScript code to eXo Platform 3.0?

Hi,

You can simply add the ga script to a web content:

  • Add a portlet contaning a web content.
  • Edit the portlet and go to the advanced tab.
  • add the following Script to the JS field (replace the "'UA-XXXXX-X" by the one given by google)

 

var _gaq = _gaq || [];

 

_gaq.push(['_setAccount', 'UA-XXXXX-X']);

_gaq.push(['_trackPageview']);

(function() {

var ga = document.createElement('script'); ga.type = 'text/javascript'; ga.async = true;

ga.src = ('https:' == document.location.protocol ? 'https://ssl' : 'http://www') + '.google-analytics.com/ga.js';

var s = document.getElementsByTagName('script')[0]; s.parentNode.insertBefore(ga, s);

})();

PS: Don't use the ga script using the document.write() methode.

 

Regards
Thank you. That did the trick. I guess their instructions that it had to be in the <HEAD> section were misleading.

Google Analytics code can take some time to execute, so if you put it in the header block, it will affect the performances of your portal, so usually it is a good approach to put the code at the end of the footer portlet, this way your pages will be fully loaded before executing the code

If you are using the traditional snippet (http://code.google.com/apis/analytics/docs/tracking/gaTrackingOverview.html) it has to be put just before the end of the "body" block. Like Nicolas said it is long to execute it thus it is better to load the page before.
If you are using the asynchronous snippet (http://code.google.com/apis/analytics/docs/tracking/asyncTracking.html) you have to put it before the end of the "head" block.

I am using the new asynchronous snippet. So I am back to my original question. How do I go about adding things to the end of the <HEAD> block? It is not controlled through site layout as far as I can see.

For now I have added it in the first content in the site layout.

I sadly don't think there is a clean solution in gatein to do that (not in platform3.x which is based on it).
The only "hack" I know is to edit templates in portal.war. Either UIPortalApplication.gtmpl or UIPortalApplicationChildren.gtmpl depending of the GA script you want to use.
Perhaps you could have a better solution by asking this on gatein forums (http://community.jboss.org/en/gatein?view=discussions).

I am having a strange problem with browser caching of static content. When I run eXo Platform 3.0 on a windows box the statics content is being cached as expected. I use Wireshark to display the HTTP responses and am getting the 304 responses as expected on static content.

But, when I take this exact same setup and run it on a Linux box (CentOS 5, Mandriva 2010) I get no caching and all content is re-downloaded every time with a 200 response. I have confirmed that the timestamps on the boxes are all correct.

What is missing in the setup, or needs to be changed to get the caching to work correctly on Linux?
[Resolved] Browser not caching when eXo run on Linux
Mark as resolved and change icon

I am having a strange problem with browser caching of static content. When I run eXo Platform 3.0 on a windows box the statics content is being cached as expected. I use Wireshark to display the HTTP responses and am getting the 304 responses as expected on static content.

But, when I take this exact same setup and run it on a Linux box (CentOS 5, Mandriva 2010) I get no caching and all content is re-downloaded every time with a 200 response. I have confirmed that the timestamps on the boxes are all correct.

Ignore this. The problem lay between the keyboard and the chair. :-)

I found I had accidently left a switch in a FF add-on (Web Developer) set to disable caching.
